ml.alternet.parser

Interface Grammar

  • All Known Subinterfaces:
    RegexpGrammar
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    Grammar$

    public interface Grammar
    Base interface for defining grammars.

    Skeleton

    import static ml.alternet.parser.Grammar.*;
import ml.alternet.parser.Grammar;

@WhitespacePolicy
public interface NumbersGrammar extends Grammar {

    // DIGIT ::= [0-9]
    @WhitespacePolicy(preserve=true)
    @Fragment
    Token DIGIT = range('0', '9').asNumber();

    // NUMBER ::= DIGIT+
    Token NUMBER = DIGIT.oneOrMore()
            .asNumber();

    // Value ::= NUMBER
    @MainRule
    @Fragment
    Rule Value = is(NUMBER);

    // the instance to use for parsing an input
    NumbersGrammar $ = $(); // must be the last field

}
    Author:
    Philippe Poulard
    See Also:
    Parsing Expression Grammar (1), Parsing Expression Grammar (2)

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Interface and Description
      static class  Grammar.CharToken
      A character token, based on compositions of character ranges.
      static class  Grammar.Choice
      A choice rule ; when parsing, the first rule that is fulfilled is selected.
      static class  Grammar.Combine
      A rule skeleton for combining rules.
      static class  Grammar.EnumToken<T>
      A token made from an enum class or a list of string values.
      static class  Grammar.EnumValueToken
      An enum value token.
      static class  Grammar.Except
      An exclusion rule.
      static interface  Grammar.Fragment
      Mark a token of a grammar that it is a fragment of a rule token, or a rule that is a fragment of a nested rule.
      static class  Grammar.GrammarToken
      A token based on a grammar.
      static interface  Grammar.MainRule
      Mark the main rule of a grammar with this annotation.
      static class  Grammar.Match
      Hold the parsing status.
      static class  Grammar.Number
      A number token.
      static class  Grammar.OneOrMore
      Make a rule repeatable.
      static class  Grammar.Optional
      Make a rule optional.
      static class  Grammar.Proxy
      Allow to separate a rule declaration and its assignment.
      static interface  Grammar.Replace
      Replace a rule/token field when extending a grammar.
      static class  Grammar.Rule
      A grammar is composed of rules that can be tokens or so-called rules.
      static class  Grammar.Sequence
      A sequence rule.
      static class  Grammar.Skip
      A token not transmitted to the event handler while parsing.
      static class  Grammar.StringToken
      A string token.
      static class  Grammar.Token
      When parsing, a token yield a EventsHandler.TokenValue.
      static class  Grammar.TypedToken<T>
      A token based on rules.
      static interface  Grammar.WhitespacePolicy
      Indicates how to process whitespaces during parsing.
      static class  Grammar.Wrapper
      A rule skeleton for composing rules.
      static class  Grammar.ZeroOrMore
      Make a rule optional repeatable.

    • Field Detail

      • $self

        static final Grammar.Rule $self
        $self is a reference to the current rule definition. Used when a rule definition refers to itself : 
        // Argument ::= FUNCTION Argument | Value | '(' Expression ')'
@Fragment Rule Argument = ( FUNCTION.seq($self) ).or(Value).or( LBRACKET.seq( Expression, RBRACKET ) );

      • $any

        The char token for any Unicode codepoint.

        static Grammar.CharToken isNot(Grammar.Token... chars)

 Token STAR = is ('*');
 // NOT_A_STAR ::= ! STAR
 Token NOT_A_STAR = isNot(STAR);
        Parameters:

      • number

        static Grammar.Number number(NumberConstraint constraint)
        Create a number token. The token value will be available as a number.
        Parameters:
        constraint - A constraint on the number, such as limiting the number of total digits to read, forcing a number to be of a given type, etc.
        Returns:
        A number token.
        See Also:
        Token NUMBER = number(NumberConstraint.BYTE_CONSTRAINT);
        (in this example the token value will be a Byte).

      • parse

        default boolean parse(Scanner scanner,
                      EventsHandler handler,
                      boolean matchAll)
               throws IOException
        Parse an input with the main rule of this grammar.
        Parameters:
        scanner - The input.
        handler - The receiver.
        matchAll - true to indicates that if the input contains more characters at the end of the parsing, an error will be reported, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if the rule was matched, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IOException - When the input cause an error.

      • parse

        default boolean parse(Scanner scanner,
                      EventsHandler handler,
                      Grammar.Rule rule,
                      boolean matchAll)
               throws IOException
        Parse an input with a rule of this grammar.
        Parameters:
        scanner - The input.
        handler - The receiver.
        rule - The rule to use for parsing the input.
        matchAll - true to indicates that if the input contains more characters at the end of the parsing, an error will be reported, false otherwise.
        Returns:
        true if the rule was matched, false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IOException - When the input cause an error.

      • $

        static <T extends Grammar> T $(Class<? extends Grammar> grammar)
        Return the singleton instance of the given grammar.
        Type Parameters:
        T - The target grammar interface.
        Parameters:
        grammar - The grammar must be an interface.
        Returns:
        An instance of the given interface, generated without methods implementation that would be specified in the interface.
        See Also:
        ByteCodeFactory.getInstance(Class)

      • $

        static <T> T $()
        Create either the singleton instance of the current Grammar or a new proxy Rule, according to how this method is invoked.

        In the following sample code, the method $() is called twice, once on a rule field, then on the grammar singleton field :

        import static ml.alternet.parser.Grammar.*;
import ml.alternet.parser.Grammar;

public interface Foo extends Grammar {

    // create a proxy rule that will be initialized later
    Rule MyRule = $();

    // create the grammar instance to use for parsing an input
    Foo $ = $(); // must be the last field

}

        In both cases, the caller of this method must be the actual grammar interface, that is to say you MUST NOT invoke that method outside for initializing a Rule or the Grammar instance elsewhere than in your grammar interface.

        Grammar field

        $() return the singleton instance of the current grammar.

        NOTE : this method MUST BE called after all fields of the interface have been properly initialized ; typically this method is used to set the LAST field of the grammar by getting its instance.

        Rule field

        $() return a new proxy rule, useful when a rule reference is expected while its definition will be specified later. It is useful when a rule is made of other rules/tokens that are defined later in the grammar.

        NOTE : all Rule fields in a grammar MUST NOT be null.

        When such proxy rule has been declared as a field in a grammar, it have to be initialized later in the grammar :

        • Either by declaring a STATIC method with the same name as the field : 
              static Rule MyRule() {
        return SomeRule.seq(OtherRule);
    }
        • Or by declaring a supplier field with the same name as the field prepend with "$" : 
              Supplier<Rule> $MyRule = () -> SomeRule.seq(OtherRule);
        • Or by declaring a dummy field that perform the initialization : 
              boolean b1 = ((Proxy) MyRule).is(
        SomeRule.seq(OtherRule)
    );
        Type Parameters:
        T - The target grammar interface OR a Rule.
        Returns:
        For the grammar field, return an instance of the given interface, generated without methods implementation that would be specified in the interface ; for a rule field, return a new proxy rule.
        Throws:
        ClassCastException - If the grammar interface defines a rule field left null.
        See Also:
        ByteCodeFactory.getInstance(Class)

      • tokenizer

        Grammar.Rule tokenizer()
        Return the "tokenizer rule", that is to say all the non-fragment tokens explicitly specified by this grammar, in their natural order.
        Returns:
        A rule with all the tokens that are not fragments : the rule (T1 | T2 | T3 ...)*
        See Also:
        Grammar.Fragment

      • mainRule

        Optional<Grammar.Rule> mainRule()
        Return the main rule of the grammar.
        Returns:
        The main rule if one has been set on the grammar or one of its interfaces.
        See Also:
        Grammar.MainRule
